input_text:
Job Title: Property Manager, Multifamily

Location: Raleigh, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Sales

Description:
Job Title

Property Manager, Multifamily

The Timbers (https://www.thetimbersraleigh.com/)

Job Description Summary

Property Managers are responsible for maintaining our communities to a market-ready standard, always ensuring high-level of service. Property Managers are also responsible for motivating high-performing teams to maximize the performance of the property

Job Description

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES:

Ensuring the smooth running of our community in a fast-paced environment. Overseeing all operations including maintenance, capital improvements, lease administration, budgeting, forecasting, reporting, collections, evictions, vacancy anticipation, marketing, lease renewals, service contracts, expense control, audits, etc. Providing superior customer service and communication to our residents and prospects to enhance customer satisfaction and increase renewals, revenue, reputation, and profitability. Complete lease/renewal paperwork to ensure completion to company standards. Track and evaluate advertising, and all client traffic. Developing, mentoring, leading, and managing a high-performing, cohesive team, including leasing, customer service, maintenance, and management personnel, in order to maximize their engagement and minimize turnover. Driving revenues with your thorough understanding and analysis of competition and development of creative marketing programs. Leading by example. Instilling, maintaining, and modeling Cushman & Wakefield’s mission to be the best national management company. Supervise day-to-day operations of the entire on-site team, ensuring that all policies and procedures are being followed. Maintain effective on-site staff through interviewing, hiring, and coaching team as necessary. Maintain residents' files in accordance with company's standards. Maintain a positive living environment for community residents through prompt conflict resolution and consistent follow-up. Manage and maintain all aspects of overall community budget and finances. Work with leasing staff to ensure that leasing/marketing goals are being met. 

COMPETENCIES: 

Effective communication and customer service skills Computer literate, including Microsoft Office Suite and internet navigation skills General office, bookkeeping and sales skills and excellent oral and written communication skills Determine leasing opportunities of staff and work on goal setting, improving the performance of each staff member. Supervise day-to-day operations of team, ensuring that all C&W policies and procedures are followed. Work with leasing staff to ensure that leasing/marketing goals are being met. Be able to manage a team Perform any other related duties as required or assigned 

IMPORTANT EDUCATION 

Bachelor’s Degree preferred Real Estate License preferred 

IMPORTANT EXPERIENCE 

3+ years of Property Management experience 3+ years of Management experience Job TitleDirector, Digital Upskilling & Change

Job Description Summary

The Head of Digital Upskilling & Change is part of the Technology Governance & Delivery team in the Technology & Data Solutions (TDS) organization. This role reports into the SVP, Technology Governance & Delivery.

We are looking for a Head of Digital Upskilling & Change who will be responsible for developing technology learning and development programming for TDS and for the broader Cushman & Wakefield user organization. This role will also design and operationalize the change management approach and standard mechanisms and toolsets that the TDS organization uses for communications within and across TDS, inclusive of how TDS markets itself to the business.

This role will

 Design and develop engaging and effective learning and development solutions that align with the business and technology strategy and facilitate digital upskilling of the organization. Define and implement standard communications practices for TDS interaction with TDS. Identify and centralize IT sales and marketing materials to provide a single source of truth for TDS and business colleague reference and to facilitate consistent storytelling. Collaborate with various stakeholders, subject matter experts and external vendors to ensure the quality and relevance of the learning content, communication standards and IT sales and marketing materials.

To Be Successful In This Role, The Right Candidate Will Have a Passion For Learning And Development, Continuous Improvement And Innovation, Marketing And Storytelling, And a Strong Consulting Background. Demonstration Of The Following Skills Is Required:

Learning & Development: Strong knowledge of learning principles, instructional design models and learning technologies.Marketing & Communications: Ability to create and execute integrated marketing communication strategies for IT products and services.Active Listening: Listen attentively and empathetically to your colleagues, learners, and stakeholders to design learning from the perspective of the learner. Ask clarifying questions, confirm your understanding, and address any concerns or issues.Clear Communication: Convey ideas clearly, listen actively, and empathize with stakeholders. Creative Thinking: Think beyond the ordinary. Generate ideas that go beyond standard approaches, encourage brainstorming and be open to diverse perspectives.Conceptual and Practical Thinking: Be visionary and innovative. Translate abstract concepts into actionable plans, bridging the gap between vision and execution.Problem-Solving: Analyze complex problems, break them down, and propose effective solutions. Think quickly and be adaptable.Collaboration: Collaborate with people at all job levels ensures to ensure successful project outcomes. Build relationships and foster teamwork.Curiosity: A curious mindset drives continuous learning. Explore new ideas, seek information, and stay updated on industry trends. Curiosity fuels growth and adaptabilityOrganization and Time Management: Be able to juggle multiple tasks and deadlines. Be organized, prioritize effectively, and manage time efficiently.

Key Outcomes:

Understand the needs and challenges of learning personas and provide them with tailored and effective solutions.Create engaging and memorable learning experiences that capture the attention of learning audiences.Create standards for TDS communications and a central marketing repository.Communicate ideas and proposals clearly and persuasively, and gain buy-in and support from various stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:

Conduct training needs analysis and identify skill gaps and learning opportunities for the Technology organization.Plan training programs based on business and TDS goals, starting with two critical areas in year 1:Design and develop Orientation and Onboarding programs for TDS new hires, transfers, and new people managers.Develop a foundational technology training program for all employees, covering topics such as productivity tools, MS Office products, AI and automation, etc.Oversee learning activities, curriculum and resources.Evaluate and measure the impact and effectiveness of the learning solutions using various methods and tools.Stay updated on the latest trends and best practices in technology learning and development and recommend new training methods as appropriate.Build and maintain a plan for ongoing growth and maturation of the central TDS Learning & Development capability, inclusive of talent, programming, and technology.Build and maintain a technology learning and development ‘community of practice’, bringing together subject matter experts that are delivering technology training programs today with a goal of standardizing consistent baseline programming, sharing learning expertise and scaling best practices.Manage the learning budget, resources, and vendors for the TDS organization.
Job Qualifications:

Strong knowledge of learning principles, instructional design models and learning technologies5+ years of experience in designing and delivering learning solutionsWork experience as a Training Director, Training Manager or similar roleIn-depth understanding of traditional and modern training methods (including workshops, simulations, e-learning and coaching)Hands-on experience with project management and budgetingProficiency in Learning Management Systems (LMS)Excellent communication and leadership skills

Skills & Personal Qualities:

Strategic mindset and ability to envision end state and the milestone activities to achieveHighly adept at project and change management, and storytellingHigh level of organization and prioritization skillsSolution oriented problem solverAnalytical and data-drivenFinancial acumenTeam Player with strong collaboration skillsManagement and leadership skillsSelf-starterAbility to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical audiencesKeen attention to detailAbility to perform under pressure

Cushman & Wakefield also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health, vision, and dental insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life, and disability insurance programs, and paid and unpaid time away from work. In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, Cushman and Wakefield provide eligible employees with competitive pay, which may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, total hours worked, job type, business line, and applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

The compensation that will be offered to the successful candidate will depend on factors such as whether the position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement, the geographic area in which the work will be performed, market pay rates in that area, and the candidate’s experience and qualifications.

The company will not pay less than minimum wage for this role.

The compensation for the position is: $153,000.00 - $180,000.00

Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position at Cushman & Wakefield, please call the ADA line at 1-888-365-5406 or email HRServices@cushwake.com. Please refer to the job title and job location when you contact us.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

other.content: Responsible for developing technology learning and development programming for TDS and facilitating digital upskilling of the organization.
Passion for learning and development, continuous improvement and innovation, marketing and storytelling, strong consulting background

Design and develop learning solutions, define and implement communications practices, identify and centralize IT sales and marketing materials, collaborate with stakeholders, subject matter experts, and external vendors

Strong knowledge of learning principles, instructional design models, learning technologies, experience in designing and delivering learning solutions, work experience as a Training Director, Training Manager, or similar role, understanding of traditional and modern training methods, hands-on experience with project management and budgeting, proficiency in LMS, excellent communication and leadership skills

Strategic mindset, project and change management, storytelling, organization, prioritization, solution-oriented problem solving, analytical, data-driven, financial acumen, team player, collaboration, self-starter, articulation, attention to detail, perform under pressure
